title: First time since Season 3 I'm averaging less than 1 game per day.
body:
I'm not going to get into why I absolutely  hate this season, but despite Season 6, I still continued to play multiple games daily.  Since then something has happened.  I started to play other games and then **Overwatch Beta** was released.  I finally played a game where I didn't care about winning or losing.  I enjoyed the game for the game.  (Same way League was to me in Season 3)

I'll probably never quit league, but for someone like me who tries to get in 3+ games per day to just play one game and be content for the day....something is seriously wrong with the season.  People say games like Overwatch are not competition because their demographic is different than MOBA's, but if it's taking away game time from league....isn't it a threat?  After all, league took me away from other mmo's, console games, and my 3ds.  

Anyway, what do you think? Are you playing less games this season? More?  Any particular reason?

replies.body:
Overwatch is new and exciting and fun.  It's the wild west, there's no meta, no history, no expectations to weigh you down.  It's not full of trolls and ragers and AFKers and bots.  The game is solidly made, fun, and everything's new and fascinating.

The honeymoon won't last forever.  Eventually a meta will creep up, people will get a sense of which character does what things and hate when it's changed, and there will be a general expectation for how to do things and what to do when and with who.  You'll eventually develop trolls, ragers, and people who can skirt the discipline system, even in a pay to play game.  The game will fill with tryhards who want to win at the expense of fun, for winning *is* their fun.  And eventually, everything will get boring and stale, the forums will fill with people complaining about patches and how the game is being 'ruined,' and matches will become boring and predictable.  It will become popular and all those people who have been with it for years will think it sucks now.

Just like Ultima Online.
Just like Counter-Strike.
Just like World of Warcraft.
Just like Starcraft.
Just like DOTA.
Just like League.

Such is the cycle of multiplayer video games.
This is probably the most educated post ive seen.

> Overwatch is new and exciting and fun. It's the wild west, there's no meta, no history, no expectations to weigh you down. It's not full of trolls and ragers and AFKers and bots. The game is solidly made, fun, and everything's new and fascinating.
> 
> The honeymoon won't last forever. Eventually a meta will creep up, people will get a sense of which character does what things and hate when it's changed, and there will be a general expectation for how to do things and what to do when and with who. You'll eventually develop trolls, ragers, and people who can skirt the discipline system, even in a pay to play game. The game will fill with tryhards who want to win at the expense of fun, for winning is their fun. And eventually, everything will get boring and stale, the forums will fill with people complaining about patches and how the game is being 'ruined,' and matches will become boring and predictable. It will become popular and all those people who have been with it for years will think it sucks now.
> 
> Just like Ultima Online.
> Just like Counter-Strike.
> Just like World of Warcraft.
> Just like Starcraft.
> Just like DOTA.
> Just like League.
> 
> Such is the cycle of multiplayer video games.


I disagree and I'll tell you why. Every single game you mentioned Character become stronger off Gold from Kills or Equipement/Loot. In Overwatch there is no Gold/Loot. If you teammate is feeding it sucks but it's still carryable. You can leave, he WILL be punished for trolling (unlike League) and once you respawn you just have to analyze the map and use the proper Hero for your team/etc. 

Overwatch will take an INSANE amount of time to master. I've seen 6 Winston's comp work, There's so much possibilities, since if you die, you aren't snowballing a member of the other team, and if you work together, you can still put the lowest skilled player on your team as the tank and just tell him to shield up.



None of that is possible in every single game you mentioned. If people feed in League, they snowball the enemy. In Dota same thing. In Starcraft you fall behind in upgrades. In Counter strike you fall behind in Gold/Weapons. In WoW you fall behind in Loot. In Ultima I don't even know wtf that game is. 


In Overwatch, you die, you give up position. Your team works as an Army Group and it feels amazing. Built in Voice comms make it nice for you to hear your teammates and chat like you're an actual **TEAM**. Not to mention, so far the community in Overwatch is pretty darn nice
Pretty much TF2

Least we can do is enjoy the highs while they last. 
And the Overwatch Beta left me with a very satisfying high, bring more on I say I'll be glad to find something to largely replace League in my schedule.
And an example of why I hate the meta; it makes games dull.
Far less, and its only declining. This games gonna drop into the hole, i can feel it and we arent gonna see it coming.
What's worse is my friends have quit since season 4.  Playing Overwatch with them reminded me how fun it was to game with those guys.

> [{quoted}](name=Im So NaCl,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZOb45it,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-05-13T02:33:25.138+0000)
>
> What's worse is my friends have quit since season 4.

^this right here. Every single one of the friends I used to play with has quit now. The game just plain isn't even close to as fun as it was a couple years ago. If it wasnt for my familiarity with LoL and the ease of sitting down to play a game, I would never play again myself either. And soon, Rito will either fix their shit or see half the player base quit for good.
The only reason I play League is to play it with friends, playing it alone is only infuriating and not fun at all

> [{quoted}](name=xAurelionxSolx,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZOb45it,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-13T02:10:12.505+0000)
>
> Far less, and its only declining. This games gonna drop into the hole, i can feel it and we arent gonna see it coming.

Oh we see it coming allright, it's the people that needs to see it coming that can't see it coming at all.
Ive got my one game in this month. Game is trash now. Broken tanks, broken mobile ADCs, no solo queue. This season is the turning point for LoL.

This is going to sound crazy but I used to play 5-6 games a day. I used to be Diamond 3. I used to play the hell out of this game. I used to complain and submit tickets because I **cared** genuinely about the game. I put up with toxicity at it's highest and even became the toxicity that I was exposed to many times. 

I've been permabanned, I've reformed, I've been a leader of a group of random strangers who felt like friends. I've been nice.

I'll be completely honest with you though. Overwatch to me, showed me how games are meant to be played. I didn't feel the weight of toxicity for the first time in a long time. I wasn't afraid to talk to give advice in fear of "FUCK YOU YOU NOOB STFU IM THE BEST BRONZE CHALLENGER PLAYER EVER" attitude that's all over League.

Teamwork just happened because we were a team, and it genuinely felt like I was playing on teams, not a bunch of random strangers on a Ego trip waiting till someone says 1 word to begin the intentional feeding.


If things ever went wrong I could just leave. I could report, but it was rarely used because people were so damn nice.

I've been going to the gym more often, doing better in schoolwork, spending more time with my gf/family. I finally realized League was actually a void in my life, it became an addition, not an enjoying one.


I tried going back, but Dynamic Q was the final straw. The toxicity is out of control, the randomness of Solo Q isn't even competitive. I played the shit out of Overwatch. I love every minute of it, even got my brother who's super busy to get back into gaming after he quit League as well. 


That's my story, enjoy it. You're not alone. Send me your battle.net we will play when Overwatch is released, I have the Origins Version.
I've seen you all around the boards before, and you are always helpful. It's a shame we are gonna lose you.
My disdain for this season got me in the gym too. I've lost 14 pounds.well said man!

Overwatch was a breath of fresh air. I felt amazing playing it.

** I felt...Happy?**

For once, I didn't care about losing, I didn't care about winning. I actually ENJOYED myself with every round.

Swapping characters to counterplay within seconds/ 5 Second respawns to jump back into the game / multiple beautiful maps / skill demanding game / and I've actually played with friends. 

It was perfect.

That's exactly how I felt as well. I didn't care about winning or losing. I. Had. Fun.  

I still have fun in league and I'm sure if they have a bounce back season I'll love it again.  Still, I can't deny Overwatch was the most fun I had in a game since I first played league.
First time since season 3 my win ratio droped belove 50%.Always had like 55% ,this season it dropped to 48%...Hmm i wonder ,why?

Season 3 was the best season I ever played.  Didn't worry about counters, didn't worry about needing to carry 4 players,  didn't worry about anything.  Just played my ranked matches and it was fun.

This season it feels like work to play League.

> [{quoted}](name=CppL,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZOb45it,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2016-05-13T06:32:09.709+0000)
>
> First time since season 3 my win ratop droped belove 50%.Always had like 55% ,this season it dropped to 48%...Hmm i wonder ,why?

maybe you're like me and you used to ward a lot?

After every back I usually came back to mid lane with 2-3 wards.  In the jungle I play utility tanks so sightstone was a common second item for me.  Even as an ADC I frequently bought wards just because I liked to split push and constantly felt in danger.  Really not liking the vision changes this season.

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZOb45it,comment-id=000800000001,timestamp=2016-05-13T19:07:46.780+0000)
>
> After every back I usually came back to mid lane with 2-3 wards.  In the jungle I play utility tanks so sightstone was a common second item for me.  Even as an ADC I frequently bought wards just because I liked to split push and constantly felt in danger.  Really not liking the vision changes this season.

right, i remember a time u could go out and pink ward and see an evelynn coming and she had no idea u knew

now she knows, and w/o oracles or anything can just sweep the ward and wait there....oh u warded? dont matter she is invis....oh u had the limit of 2 pink wards on you? u put the other and now thats gone to

all of that over the fact that.....people didnt want to spend money on wards...so they figured give everyone free ones with limits so people use em


people still dont use em, and now im hindered with invis champs and limited to 3 wards
(when i started i used to duo support with my friend and i had PLENTY of games when i ended with only a sightstone and teir 2 boots, everything else was wards)

u know what didnt happen? i didnt get ganked...sure id be behind in items but my team could work the map better

but now? no orcales and it seems like the enemy team has wards everywhere while i got the beg my team to at least use one of their 2 charges on their FREE ward lol...

many changes like this were weak af, but riot doesnt really care what we thought about that or anything else

and reverts? LOLOLOL, i think of reverts like i think of riots promises like soloque....not gonna happen
THIS. I HATE that they removed green wards. You used to be rewarded for prioritizing vision.now you have to hide under your tower in fear, waiting for your trinkets insanely long cd.

I think it's because you are tiring out of League.
I started back in Season 4, but when I really started to play the game was in Season 5. Lots of people say that they really hate this season, but I personally like it more than Season 5. I am also playing less games, but it's not because of the season.
That's just **my** input

You're still a new(ish) player - it's expected that you find this fun because you weren't around for the times people label as "more fun than this."

To further address the tiring argument, as someone who started playing WoW at the start of 2005, I didn't quit because I was tired of it, I quit because the developers haven't cared about feedback for the last 6 years and as a result, the game went into the trashcan we told them it would end up in, and now they're too embarrassed to post their hemorrhaging subscriber count, still insisting they know what's best for the game. 

Riot is beginning to show the starting signs of Blizzard's descent into madness or whatever the hell happened there, and a lot of us don't want to see the same thing happen again here.  All of these _Goodbye_ posts should be a warning that something isn't right, and they're driving people away with controversial, negatively received, and flat-out unhealthy changes to LoL.

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZOb45it,comment-id=00160000,timestamp=2016-05-13T17:56:37.686+0000)
>
> You're still a new(ish) player - it's expected that you find this fun because you weren't around for the times people label as "more fun than this."
> 
> To further address the tiring argument, as someone who started playing WoW at the start of 2005, I didn't quit because I was tired of it, I quit because the developers haven't cared about feedback for the last 6 years and as a result, the game went into the trashcan we told them it would end up in, and now they're too embarrassed to post their hemorrhaging subscriber count, still insisting they know what's best for the game. 
> 
> Riot is beginning to show the starting signs of Blizzard's descent into madness or whatever the hell happened there, and a lot of us don't want to see the same thing happen again here.  All of these _Goodbye_ posts should be a warning that something isn't right, and they're driving people away with controversial, negatively received, and flat-out unhealthy changes to LoL.

Now that you mention it... it's kinda true. I mean, look at the whole Dynamic Queue announcement. So many people were saying how it was going to be, and Riot (Lyte particularly) kept saying "at least try it before complaining, and if it doesn't work we won't have any problem scrapping it". Guess what... what every said was going to happened was exactly what happened.

I guess what they say is true... unless you learn from it, history is doomed to repeat itself.

I'm a guy who likes to win so I got a tad bit upset losing in overwatch but I would immediately go back into it and start another game just cause it was a blast to play. I do the same thing with league but it's starting to waver really hard especially with this patch. Things just aren't fun when you get blasted each game or you stop them into oblivion there is never back and forth it is just either you cheese your opponent harder than they cheese you and there is very little reward for good play. It just a pure luck thing now if you win or not there is no such thing as skill and god help you if you try playing something off meta you just get royally hammered in lane from an op meta pick like ekko or gankplank
The meta is killing it for me. That and they keep changing the game, new drags, herald buff, weird items etc..

I said the same exact thing I only play like 1 or 2 games a day now when I used to play a ton, the overwatch beta made me realize there are way better games that are better than league out there and I hate the way league is becoming

Tried for the first few months of S6, but I've totally quit this game. For me it's 2 parts.
1. They reworked Fiora, the only champ I really played. Then she was permabanned, now shes nerfed to shit thanks to terrible %hp true damage design.
2. This game is a massive CHORE to play at this point. Every two weeks I have to read a 30 page document about what changed. They should rename patch notes to TPS reports, because I feel like an office worker in a cube trying to keep up with this stupid game.

I can't wait for Overwatch.
Sorry for the Fiora change.  Right now Gnar is my saving grace.  He won't be reworked for awhile.  I hope you enjoy Overwatch.   It really was a blast in beta.
I quit for a month due to this and only play ARAM now.

I like this season.

It gave me motivation to learn DOTA.

Meepo, Timbersaw, and Wraith King are all fun as hell.

More than anything I think you're going through the early stages of burnout.

Also when you fall in love with a game any change can aversely affect your appreciation. For example in Smash there's Melee and there's the Brawl mod Project M. Project M is objectively far more balanced than Melee, but lots of people still consider Melee the superior game for numerous valid reasons (personally I prefer PM). They could potentially one day make this game more balanced than it's ever been, but the fact of the matter is that this wont ever be the same game that you fell in love with when you played Season 3.

> [{quoted}](name=TotalJerk,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EZOb45it,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2016-05-13T07:47:09.020+0000)
>
> More than anything I think you're going through the early stages of burnout.
> 
> Also when you fall in love with a game any change can aversely affect your appreciation. For example in Smash there's Melee and there's the Brawl mod Project M. Project M is objectively far more balanced than Melee, but lots of people still consider Melee the superior game for numerous valid reasons (personally I prefer PM). They could potentially one day make this game more balanced than it's ever been, but the fact of the matter is that this wont ever be the same game that you fell in love with when you played Season 3.

cant really be burning out of a game if its not the same game u have been playing lol no offense or anything but the games changed so much this season as compared to other seasons (sure there was broken stuff but it would always be a couple things, not like 30 things)

same, since season six all i do league related is read the boards once in a while and watch nighblue3, playing isnt fun anymore, its 3/4 of the time a painfull game filled with hate and inflated egos and the remaining games are simple normal games nothing exiting anymore, for me at least

Though season 1-3, I'd play around 8-12 games a day, each day in the week, except for holidays of course. In season 5 & 6, about 1-4 a day couple days, barely reaching how many I used to play in a day through an entire week. Yeah I'm getting tired with with the direction riot has been going; more overloaded champions & reworks, even more refusal to balance, ever more impatience with strategy.

>Are you playing less games this season? More? Any particular reason?

Tendinosis - recommended that I don't play at all and to be honest, I'm glad.  Can't say I'm missing League this season so thankfully it happened recently.
I was playing more because I got a new PC and wanted gold. Now that I got it I pretty much just try for the first win of the day.

from my personal experience, ive tried Overwatch (it could have been any new game actualy) which drag me away from league.
first lets say i was easily playing 3-4 game per day which is alot of time for someone like me who work 48H/week.
since season 6 i started playing less and less feel free to chek my history and stuff ive played since season 2 alot.
then while i was playing Overwatch i tought i would go back to league after the beta period end but no .. just the break i took from league by playing something else for some consecutive days, cured me from the league addiction, i am now clean and the only thing that Riot could do to get me back in would be an annoncement of a real soloQ (even if a big number of chars still broken AF compare to the state of the game 2-3 years ago)

Maybe Riot GameS will release another game and we'll all play that instead.

This season was horrendous and Riot has slowly been reverting some changes. Yes REVERTING. They never admit to their faults.. but you can see it happening

I pointed out a while ago that they're subtlety addressing and in some cases yes, slowly _reverting_ some of the horrific pre-season changes we screamed bloody murder about being broken or unbalanceable.  Again, my hope is by the end of this season, they'll have gathered all of the data (yes, REAL data this time, Lyte...) they require to post a "what we learned from season 6" dev blog where this season was actually just a giant experiment all along, and the season 7 design philosophy will go back to focusing on what makes the game fun to play rather than fun to watch.

Then again, pride-fueled insanity is a real danger to  devs who work on games that grew to big too fast *cough* Warcraft *cough* and they forget about the community that built the game up from nothing, becoming so detached that they feel they don't need feedback anymore.  Kinda like J. Allen "You don't want that. You think you do but you don't" Brack. 

If that's the case, the only way feedback works, which sadly seems the case already, is there's usually only change when the devs feel the same way...which isn't effective because the devs tend to do whatever they want anyway regardless of feedback, at least from a gameplay and balance point of view.

What scares me is that doesn't Blizzard have that kind of attitude towards its playerbase as well? Like the whole "We know better then the people playing our game." That kinda scares me for Overwatch.

As far as I know, a lot of the devs that were on the original WoW team went over to Titan which became Overwatch.  I'm confident that the community is in good hands, but I've been burned by Blizz before for being hopeful.  It depends on what Activi$ion thinks about its success and if they decide they want even more money - that's when things might get ugly.
Oh joy. Welp, lets enjoy it while it lasts.

> I'll probably never quit league

Look daddy! A realistic thinking person!

A few things to note here:
I don't think you enjoyed past seasons a lot more than you do this one, you might! but I don't think you did.
It's most likely that you remembered some specific thing about LoL in the past, and it's a lot more fun in your memories than it actually was in reality. AKA: nostalgia xP

I've been playing less LoL recently, because I simply don't have time :l Yeah...
I've also tried smite, because I'm a huge mythology lover. But it didn't give me that enjoyment League gave me... 
So I'm still playing LoL.

I'd recommend you to think bad about the past, think about what champions you used to play in earlier seasons, and try them again.
I've been getting back into Renekton recently. His new lore refreshed my love for him, and playing him refreshed my love for LoL.

Have fun playing whatever you end up doing ^^

Only casuals turn to Overwatch. It's basically TF2 with powers. I don't see why it should be a threat. Eventually the "meta" will be unveiled and everyone will pick that one hero that is super op. It's just new, that's all.

I don't see how a game with Pixar styled storytelling could rival League in any way other than popularity.
Casuals turn to Overwatch, yet the game is still beta and people are already making competitive teams for it?
Same with Call of Duty. It's a joke.
